section.para: blaze.bat allows you to run all &PRODUCT; utilities with a single command.

section.title: Description
section.para: blaze.bat provides a common way to run &PRODUCT; utilities with a single command.

listitem.para: Runs blaze-init, a utility that either creates a &PRODUCT; repository, or recovers a previously corrupted one. Refer to for a full description of the command usage.
Runs blaze-config, a utility that either displays, or sets &PRODUCT; configuration options. Refer to for a full description of the command usage.
Runs blaze-add, a utility that adds a blog post or a page to the &PRODUCT; repository. Refer to for a full description of the command usage.
Runs blaze-edit, a utility that edits a blog post or a page in the &PRODUCT; repository. Refer to for a full description of the command usage.
Runs blaze-remove, a utility that removes a blog post or a page from the &PRODUCT; repository. Refer to for a full description of the command usage.
Runs blaze-list, a utility that lists blog posts or pages in the &PRODUCT; repository. Refer to for a full description of the command usage.
Runs blaze-make, a utility that generates a blog from the &PRODUCT; repository. Refer to for a full description of the command usage.
Runs blaze-log, a utility that displays the &PRODUCT; repository log. Refer to for a full description of the command usage.
Displays usage information, either for the utility itself, or for the selected command.
Display usage of the blaze-config command:
listitem.screen:
C:\> blaze help config Usage: blaze-config [-qV] [-b DIRECTORY] [-E EDITOR] OPTION [VALUE...] blaze-config -e [-b DIRECTORY] blaze-config -h|-v
-b, --blogdir DIRECTORY specify a directory in which the BlazeBlogger repository is placed -E, --editor EDITOR specify an external text editor -e, --edit edit the configuration in a text editor -q, --quiet do not display unnecessary messages -V, --verbose display all messages -h, --help display this help and exit -v, --version display version information and exit

listitem.para: blaze-init creates a &PRODUCT; repository, or recovers a previously corrupted one.
blaze-config displays or sets &PRODUCT; configuration options.
blaze-add adds a blog post or a page to the &PRODUCT; repository.
blaze-edit edits a blog post or a page in the &PRODUCT; repository.
blaze-remove removes a blog post or a page from the &PRODUCT; repository.
blaze-list lists blog posts or pages in the &PRODUCT; repository.
blaze-make generates a blog from the &PRODUCT; repository.
